intro: [WRONG START] Rubus vulgarus subsp. clethraphilus, commonly known as clethra-like blackberry, is a shrub native to the British Isles and parts of Europe. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in woodland and hedgerow environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
